metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9591 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
JasPer before version 2.0.12 is vulnerable to a use-after-free in the way it decodes certain JPEG 2000 image files resulting in a crash on the application using JasPer.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9591` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjasper-runtime - 1.900.1-14ubuntu3.4
libjasper1 - 1.900.1-14ubuntu3.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: jasper package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.900.1-14ubuntu3.4').
